19.61. Let A = {Ar | r ∈ Φ} be an elementary carpet of type Φ over a commutative ring K (see 7.28), and let Φ(A) = ⟨xr(Ar) | r ∈ Φ⟩ be its carpet subgroup. Define the closure of the carpet A to be the set of additive subgroups Ā = {Ār | r ∈ Φ}, where Ār = {t ∈ K | xr(t) ∈ Φ(A)}. Is the closure Ā of a carpet A always a carpet?
An affirmative answer is known if Φ = Al, Dl, El.
Ya. N. Nuzhin
